result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. De'erick Quashawn Riley

records.addlTxt: Forthwith Order.  Signed and Filed.  nk
Order of Commitment for Treatment

Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for De'erick Quashawn Riley.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  Defense counsel challenges the findings of the doctor's report.
Sworn for the state: PsyD Jenna Niess. Cross exam. Evidence closed. 

For reasons stated on the record, the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency. 

**  The Court further found that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication for the mental condition.  **

Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 36.
Review hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for De'erick Quashawn Riley.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a competency hearing.  Doctor Jenna Goebel on Zoom for testimony.  Parties are notified by deputies that Mr. Riley is unstable at this time and cannot be brought to court.  Court rescheduled competency hearing with Doctor Goebel.  Court approves Zoom appearances at next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Competency hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for De'erick Quashawn Riley.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is refusing to appear for today's hearing. Case is scheduled for a return on doctors report. Defense is requesting a hearing. Proceedings remain suspended. Court orders defendant REMANDED pending competency hearing. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Competency hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed: Attorney Thomas Harris
Proposed Order:  Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an order to show cause hearing.  Court appoints Attorney Thomas Harris at a rate of $125 per hour.  Doctor's report filed on 7-20-22.  Court scheduled a return on Doctor's report.  Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley not in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Thomas Reed cannot appear. Defendant is in custody. Case is adjourned to allow the public defenders office to appear.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Appointment Status Letter Filed
Filed
Made in error.

Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley not in court, defendant in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Doctor's Report Return. Defendant has not been appointed counsel. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley not in court, defendant in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Doctor's Report Return. Defendant has not been appointed counsel and a report has not been filed. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Return on warrant. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings, and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Court ordered case is adjourned, Branch 38.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. The defendant having failed to appear the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Pretrial Services Supervision (DISCHARGE) Report; filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION) Report; filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION) Report; FILED.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant De'erick Quashawn Riley in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  De'erick Quashawn Riley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
